title: Many students find it difficult to pay attention at school. What are the reasons for this? What could be done to solve this problem?
content:
Due to increasing pressure and various other circumstances, children nowadays find it challenging to engage and concentrate on their academics at school. However, there are certain measures that can be taken to resolve this issue and make learning more fun and enjoyable for students. 

Primarily, the lack of attention is due to the traditional teaching techniques followed by institutions. Passive teaching is sure to bore students rather than develop their talents since each student's grasping ability differs. The teachers are instructing students to memorise the answers instead of engaging in brainstorming and creative learning activities. The students rely on their memory and write the answer in the examination, which becomes the reason for frustration among the students. The use of portable devices such as mobile phones during lectures is another source of distraction. Instead of focusing on academics, students spend the majority of their time playing video games and surfing the internet. 

Alternatively, if instructors in schools use active learning techniques, in which each student is given the opportunity to exhibit what they have learned, students' learning will increase. Teachers should also use a variety of instructional strategies to pique students' interest and engagement, such as presenting videos, engaging through presentations, and personally contacting students. Finally, because distractions like video games and cell phones are the most prevalent cause of a child's lack of interest in studying, they should be banned in schools, and parents should impose a daily usage restriction on them. 

To sum up, modern teaching techniques should be implemented in order to develop students' enthusiasm for learning and gadgets should be prohibited and limited because they tend to act as a barrier and reduce students' effectiveness

title: The diagram below shows how glass is recycled.
content:
The diagram illustrates the process of making a glass usable again.

Overall, the process consists of six stages, beginning with putting it into a recycle bin and ending up with delivery to the supermarket.

First of all, used or empty glass bottles are kept separately in a green recycle bin where the signature of the recycling is displayed. After that, with the use of a vehicle the collected materials are taken to the treatment plant and stored there. Next, the collected glasses  are washed using a sterilising machine to ensure that the harmful bacteria and germs are totally eliminated.

In the next stage, the sterilised bottles are crushed and melted with the crushing and melting machine where they are converted into liquid. Following this, the liquids are poured into the moulding machine where they are designed to provide an accurate shape and size of the bottle.

Finally, they are made ready to be delivered to the supermarkets.

title: Some people believe that education success mostly depends on teachers. Others however say that it depends more on the attitude of student and their willingness to study. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
content:
Nowadays, an increasing number of people succeed in their education. Some people think that education success mostly depends on teachers, while others argue that it depends more on the attitude of students and their willingness to study. In fact, I side with those who believe that academic success depends on the student's attitudes and abilities. 

On the one hand, the teacher is the most important in academic success. It is believed that a good teacher will make the students better. Teachers can be easily role models for their pupils. By being role models, teachers can shape the students' characters. Students will listen easily to their teachers. For instance, students become more diligent because they love to learn with their favourite teachers at school. As a result, students can achieve academic success easily.

On the other hand, the attitudes of students and their willingness plays an essential part to be successful in academic. Many people believe that attitude can show how far the students have learned. Moreover, the ability to answer teacher questions correctly means they learn seriously and regularly. These habits will shape them to become disciplined and responsible. It will help them to get better scores at school. For illustration, pupils that review their material at home will get a better understanding of that subject. Consequently, pupils can be more competitive to get the best score.

To sum up, there are many ways to achieve academic success. However, many people believe that teachers become the most important part to make students good at school. Meanwhile, others argue that attitudes and abilities to answer teachers' questions are essential parts of gaining success in academics. I am firmly convinced that good attitudes and abilities play important roles in academic success.

title: In the future, people may no longer be able to pay for things in shops using cash. All payments may have to be made by card or using phones. Do you think this will happen one day? Why do you think some people might not be happy to give up using cash?
content:
It is predicted that time ahead, payments in stores will change to a card or an application on mobile phones. People do not need to bring cash when they are going to shop. In this particular essay, we will discuss why this event pretends to happen and the potential reason why some individuals may be reluctant to abandon the use of cash.

In this era, technology become developed. It may lead to behaviour shifts in several aspects of this life. One of the aspects that influenced is shopping behaviour amongst people. For example, the shifting of payment methods that will be used when people do shop. There will be a new payment method using cards or payment applications on a smartphone. This payment method can be called a cashless payment method. It will help people in more efficiently when bringing a thing during shopping.

On the other hand, there are some people who may not agree with this new payment method. Several people who tend to not be happy with this event are coming from sellers. It is because there is a regulation from the government, that there will be extra charges for the store to the bank as a cashless payment fee. This extra charge most likely applied to the store ,not the customer. Stores will be facing a decrease in their revenue from this regulation.

In a nutshell, a shifting of payment methods from cash to cashless will happen in the future due to the development of technology. However, there are several people who come from sellers who might not agree with this shifting due to the extra charge that they need to pay to the bank.

title:

content:
In this day, the worldwide percentage of obese people is rapidly increasing. Although often debated, a major cause is due to the sedentary lifestyle and unhealthy food choices. In this essay, a look at these causes and their effects will be made.

   Firstly, the two most major reasons for obesity are due to the unhealthy lifestyle and diets with a lack of nutrients trends in the 21st century. For instance, a study conducted by the American obesity society found that the fast meal industry market has increased doubled since the 2000s. It can easily be seen when people have busy daily lives, they towards to choose easy lunches and dinners with fast foods and microwavable diets, which contain much fat and sugar content. Moreover, people don’t spend their time taking part in exercise in their daily lives. Thus, this lack of physical activities combined with processed food lead to  overweighting. 

   The effects of obesity are countless but a major one is that obesity leads to massive health problems. To illustrate, as evidenced in the United Kingdom, many scientists have pointed out that over 70 percent of fat people likely to face up with diseases such as heart failure, and diabetes, which are two of the leading causes of death. As a result, millions of dollars have been spent each year due to their diabetes and heart failure medications. Thus, it is clear that these effects need to be mostly decreased to reform the quality of life for future generations. 

   To conclude,  awareness and healthy food options, as well as, more social physical exercise are  significant ways to prevent  obesity. It is predicted that both schools and parents will encourage their children to have nourishing diets and follow  healthy lifestyle trends.

title: More and more people are becoming seriously overweight. Some people suggest that the solution to this problem is to increase the price of  fattening foods. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
In today's world, obesity is becoming a big problem in many parts of the world. Recently, the number of obsessed people is increasing so fast that some suggest that, the main culprits like fast food and unhealthy food, needed to be taxed to discourage people from consuming too much. This essay will try to argue that increasing the price of junk food will not help people fight this obesity crisis.

In human history, obesity was never run rampant like this before. The obesity pandemic is a very modern problem, in the past, it is very hard to find poor people who were overweight in contrast to the present where most of the obsessed people come from low-income households. The main cause of this is that most of the time the only food these low-income people can afford is either low-quality and low-price fast food or heavily processed food that has low nutrition but high sugar and fat to compensate for the low-quality ingredient used to keep the price low. By levying the tax on junk food industries it will, in reality, make the problem much worse than it already is. If junk food increases in price then it will force people who can bearly afford to consume this already low-quality product to find the even lower-quality alternative.

In contrast, rather than put a tax on low-quality food it is better to spend money subsidizing or cutting taxes on healthy food options. If the root cause of obesity comes from overconsumption of low-quality consumption goods then the solution is to change the consumer choice. Since food is an essential part of life it is impossible to tell people to eat less expressly to those low-income who bearly scrape by even with low-cost fast food. Giving some incentives, like lowering taxes on healthier option products or subsidizing high-quality unprocessed ingredients, to fast food chains and food manufacturers to produce healthier products for the same price as the unhealthy product can help solve the overweight problem in the lower class who the most susceptible to the obesity pandemic.

In conclusion . For many people being obsessed didn't come from their personal choice but the lack of choices that cause them to resort to fattening food for sustenance. By giving those people a healthier affordable option, it will help them much more in the long term than to just increasing the prices of junk food which is their only option for food. And that is why I strongly disagree with increasing fast food prices as a solution to the obesity problem.

title:
Some people think that cultural traditions may be destroyed when they are used as money-making traditions aimed at tourists, others, however, believe that it is the only way to save these traditions. 

Discuss both views and give your opinion
content:
The tourism industry is an essential part of Vietnam's total GDP. To develop it further, travel agents have utilized all their means to create new experiences. But in the process, there have been some hot debates about whether or not commercializing cultural traditions is a sensible decision. In my opinion, both views have their legitimate reasons.

On the one hand, the continuous expansion of tourism has several consequences. The first negative effect is that heritage sites and monuments are jam-packed with tourists, causing damage to them. For instance, the influx of tourists in the ancient town of Hoi An carved their names on the walls, which vandalized the historical landmark. Moreover, the uncontrolled development of tourism can deteriorate the environment and threaten wildlife. A simple example is Nha Trang beach with garbage floating all over its coast, causing loss of scenery, water pollution, and harm to marine life.

On the other hand, some argue that putting a price on cultural tours is the only method to keep them from fading away. First, revenue from sightseeing, art performances, and other tourist activities is used largely for restoration efforts. Without enough financial support, various attraction sites may fall into disrepair. Another reason is that tourism helps promote cultural exchange. Tourists can visit many historical significance places and talk to local people to gain an in-depth understanding about the area's culture. This encourages the revival of traditions and elevates cultural values.

To sum up, it is beyond doubt that developing tourism brings both positive and negative impacts. Governments and authorities should not lose sight of this fact before deciding on expanding the tourism industry.

title: The high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising but not the real need of the society where such products are sold. Do you agree or disagree?
content:
It is considered that increasing the supply of some famous consumable item which was actually not in demand can be achieved with the influence of advertisement. I completely agree with this concept because an interesting presentation creates curiosity and most people fall for it despite the real cost-benefit-need analysis. In this essay, we will see how it works with some examples.

Firstly,  advertisements create an interactive interface in a person's mind and when they are interesting and relevant by any means induce desire. In my hometown, people are fond of making a special sweet called Khasta as it is a household name and included in everyday meals. Citizens use traditional equipment made of wood to shape it as shaping with hands is tedious and time-consuming. A famous Kitchen utensil manufacturer developed the same device out of steel and brought it into the market but was unsuccessful. Then they began advertising after 3 years of product lunch and soon their sales tripled the following year. But soon the habitats realized that the sweet was missing in taste, texture and durability. 

Later, after numerous consumer complaints, the local government began to investigate. when the inspection was completed it was found that there was no problem with the manufacturer's equipment but it was the wood which rich the taste. The report says  it was the specific wood which has a unique compound called "bibi" in the local language which adds flavour to the sweet and was responsible for the preservation for a longer duration whereas the steel lacks that. Moreover, the tree was locally inhabited so the multinational manufacturer had no knowledge about it. They found that the product is very popular in other states however so, it would be an easy go, it did but did not prolong.

Overall, the power of advertisement does increase sales in the market where there is no demand but how long the demand lasts is completely dependent on the consumer. Hence, I would suggest making proper research on the actual practice of the habitats before launching the device into the market.

title: Environmental problems such as pollution and climatic variations are increasing nowadays. The governments have taken some measures at a global level. But they got only few solutions. Why is it so? How can this be solved?
content:
Pollution and climate change are going up every day. Moreover, governments are offering solutions that are not effective on a worldwide scale. In this essay, I will explain the reasons behind this and provide some potential solutions.

If we compare the world now to 100 years ago, we can identify the problem. In the past, people lived in rural areas and consumed what they grew. However, after the industrial revolution, more communities migrated to cities and their habits shifted from being producers to consumers. Companies now strive to sell their products in order to increase their wealth, and governments do not have the authority to limit them, so even in developed countries this problem remained as it was. Additionally, the media industry and the internet assist companies in reaching customers worldwide. Resulting in increased use of fossil fuel products delivery. For instance, wooden types of furniture can produce in any country, but for the sake of advertisements, imported type is used.

Another issue is the encouragement of excessive consumption. In the past one car was sufficient for a family, but now it has become common for each person to own their own car. With the increasing human population on Earth, the need for food is undeniable. As a result, organizations are employing conservation and other production techniques to produce and store food for longer periods of time or cutting trees of jungles to build construction for industrial reasons. However, this leads to the use of more industrial machines, facilities and pesticides in agriculture. While there are benefits to these practices, associations often use excessive amounts of water and pollute it before returning to nature. For example, in my country, one of the most well-known companies is a major contributor to water pollution as they release dirty water into rivers, and the government cannot do anything about it.

In summary, these changes are inevitable, but humans are accelerating them. The only way to slow down these changes is by teaching people to love the Earth like other creatures in the world.

title: All cars that burn fossil fuels should be banned and electric cars should replace them. Do you agree or disagree?

To conclude, yes, I strongly agree that banning petrol and diesel cars would benefit and as mentioned above EVs are the most eco-friendly, improve air quality and reduce noise pollution. Additionally, they bring long-term cost savings too.

title: People from older generations have difficulty using smartphones and new technology. What is the cause of this? What are some possible solutions?
content:
It is needless to enlighten, today's world has modernized a lot compared to the old era. New technologies and developments have drastically changed the living style that can be observed evitably in our forefathers and current community. The latest innovations like smartphones, tablets, and other electronic gadgets are a nightmare for elderly people, they encounter troubles while dealing with modern machines. This essay will outline some causes being faced by old folks while using advanced machinery and solutions to curb this menace.

There are myriad reasons related to the problems of past generations in handling technological devices. First and foremost is unawareness of recent advancements. People from previous decades had limited resources and knowledge. There were not enough facilities available for them to learn and research about changes in the world, and the media was also restricted to certain areas only. Besides, technology itself not being mature compared to what it is in the day. For example, only a few people have smartphones equipped with very limited features. As a result, the old folks could not have opportunities to come in contact with a variety of technological development causing troubles for them in today's innovative nature. Another reason for the stated problem is the old generation's lack of information, literacy plays a vital role in human development. Because of poor education resources and limited investigation departments at the global level in the early 90s, the Elderly society spent most of its time hard working. For instance, conquering the moon was beyond the imagination. However, analysis blocks like NASA, Space X,  and many others around the world had achieved this milestone.

Thus, limited resources along with research centres, poor education systems, and unawareness of advancement were the main problematic areas for our forefathers in handling new technologies.

There are colossal ways and means that can be taken for its remedy. Firstly, the young generation has a pivotal role to deal with this problem. They should spend some of their time with their grandparents regularly to make them aware of the latest technologies like smartphones, and tablets and guide them about the benefits it has brought into our lives. In addition to that higher authorities should establish awareness centres, especially for old people where they can learn about modern innovation and also the usage of electronic gadgets.

To recapitulate, indeed, the old generation usually is not updated about the latest innovations and developments. However, individuals and authorities should put their best foot forward by introducing awareness campaigns & programs for modern technology. Whereas the young generation should also spend time with their grandparents at home to guide them about the use of the latest electronic equipment.

title:
The diagram below shows the stages and equipment used in the process of making matches. 

Summarize the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and make comparisons where relevant
content:
This diagram illustrates the various stages of manufacturing matches. 

In general, to begin the creation of matches consists of four stages: cleaning to drying, and this is before being sent to production. This is followed by six stages, beginning with the input of sticks and ending with boxes of the finished product.

In the first phase, the revolving log is peeled by using a blade, followed by cutting the veneer into sticks. Next, they are immersed in a tank that contains ammonium phosphate. Afterwards, they are placed in a large, spinning drum, where they are dried. Last but not least, the matches dump into the hopper and blow through a metal duct to a warehouse. 

In the next step, when the wooden sticks arrive at the storage facility, they are moved into the funnel using a conveyor belt. Then, they are inserted into a moving, perforated steel belt and each tip of the stick is dipped into different, three tanks. Next, they enter the drying area and after that, the final product, so the matches are packaged.

title:
Some countries have introduced laws to limit the working hours that an employer can ask from an employee.

Why are these law introduced?

Is this a positive or negative trend?
content:
In a few nations, it has become a trend of more working hours. In my opinion, such a type of labour law will stop exploitation and will have a positive impact on the workers.

There are several reasons behind the long working duties. Mainly, the invention of new technologies keeps employees busy even after their daily office time.For example, it is too easy to be in touch with your clients through notifications on the smartphone or e-mail. It is mandatory for some higher-level person to reply to it. Secondly, during industrial, expansion  employers take advantage of needy employees and push them to work for 12-14 hours as a slave, and if they deny they may suffer from job loss or maybe  financial issues.

The implementation of the limited working time law offers a worker to have a mental, physical and social pace. Like, factory workers hardly get moments to spend with their families as they suppose to stay on the same premise after long duties. The limited engagement of work will help them to spend a good time with their family which leads to strong family life. To continue, in such countries where there are no rules of labour time forces too manpower in physical exploitation especially with child labour.

To conclude, the need for laws related to controlling working hours occurs because of new inventions and unlimited greed. By introducing, law it becomes easy to develop both a mental and social environment in the country by considering its own perspective.

title: Some cities have vehicle-free days when private cars, trucks and motorcycle are banned from the city centre. People are encouraged to use public transport such as buses, taxies and metro on vehicle-free day. To what extent do you think the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
content:
Today, people have a variety of vehicle options to go  anywhere. However, these vehicles lead to some environmental problems such as air pollution, global warming, climate change and so on. Therefore, people need a comprehensive plan to address the results of using vehicles. Some cities have vehicle-free days to promote the use of public transport. In my opinion, despite some obvious drawbacks which should not be overlooked, I think the benefits of a vehicle-free day outweigh.

The advantages of using public transport should be taken into consideration. The major benefit of using public transport which should be initially referred to is that people can be more healthy and problems in the field of environment reduce sharply. Vehicle pollutants harm our health and contain greenhouse gases that cause climate change. If people are unaware of climate change possibility, they will face its results which are famine, drought, and flooding. For instance, a survey found that more than 45% of people living in cities which are not used public transport have more risk to be asthma and breathing difficulties because of toxic gases.

Another significant advantage of using public transport is that it helps to protect nonrenewable energy resources which as oil. Due to the ever-increasing number of people, nonrenewable energy resources reduce dramatically. However, people need these energy resources because they are energy-rich and relatively cheap to process. For this reason, thanks to vehicle-free days, people can be aware of the detrimental effects of oil consumption.

To sum up, vehicle-free days are beneficial to prevent mentioned above adverse effects of using private vehicles.

title: Nowadays, many people have to work longer hours, and they feel more stressed out than before. What are the reasons? What can employers do to make their life easier?
content:
It is undeniable that affording life expenses become a significant issue among people, and this phenomenon has affected mental health. This essay will examine the roots and possible solutions to maintain this concern.

On the one hand, There are several reasons for people struggling with nervousness due to financial barriers. First of all, It is evident to everybody that working conditions have become more complicated, and this situation has led to confined employees to their job in order to keep their job secure. Furthermore, life expenses have become a principal dilemma among folks. They should afford the cost of rent, installments, or even unforeseen expenses like disease treatment. Hence, these causes play a key role in employees' mental health.

It is worth mentioning that employers could act as a vital role in combating the devastating disorder. For instance, employers can offer some promotions based on employees' competency. Employers can consider a program for employees in which they can raise their salary if they have some proposals in order to enhance company income. On the other hand, employers can consider a break time for rest each hour or even provide some gaming counselors in order to have moments of tranquility and vitality with colleagues. Therefore, there are several opportunities that employers can offer to cease employees' mental issues.

To draw a conclusion, it should be reiterated that even though financial barriers are an inseparable dilemma in this hectic life, employers could act as a vital role in alleviating this detrimental disorder.

title: Some people think that it is effective for students to study in a group at school, while others think it is better to study alone. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
content:
It is often argued by some individuals that group study is more efficacious for pupils, while others are of the opinion that it is better for them to study on their own. In this essay, I will outline arguments for and against the method of study and I will state my viewpoint on this issue.

To commence with, the majority of people are convinced that it provides positive impacts for pupils to do group-based study at school. To express it more plainly, the shared study approach motivates students to take part in discussions and find  solutions by brainstorming with one another which really makes the study process fun and interesting. Not only are the students encouraged to be more active, but also they learn teamwork as well as other social skills. To give an instance, Although some courses were too boring and tedious for me during university, I found out that by collaborative learning with other students, I can make them too entertaining and get good grades as group study avoid us to be tired.

However, there are some individuals who opine that it is advantageous for students to study lonely. To put it another way, they believe that pupils must be able to analyze  scientific subjects alone to learn  problem-solution skills. For instance, some surveys and research showed that students who sued to study alone usually have better capabilities to come up with difficulties and are able to control hard situations. Moreover, they can be better tutors in future too. 

In my opinion, both methods are advantageous for students provided that they opt for one of the correct methods regarding their interests and the characteristics of the courses. I myself found both of them applicable during school and university. 

To conclude, both group study and study alone have their own advantages such as motivating students and strengthening problem solution skills of pupils, respectively.

title: Many people say that globalization and the growing number of multinational companies have a negative effect on the environment. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your position.
content:
In recent years, globalization and multinational companies have grown rapidly, and some people argue that they have drawbacks for the environment. I entirely agree with this statement due to the increasing amount of gas emissions and decreasing green spaces that I will discuss in this essay.

First, the growth of globalization makes it easier for people to travel anywhere and anytime; however, it can effect the environment due to the increasing amount of gas emissions. Most people prefer to commute by using their private vehicles or an airplane if they go aboard. As a consequence, using those transport modes can result in gas emissions, which can destroy our environment. For example, the top executive managers in big companies who have several offices in different countries will use airplanes and private cars when they have meeting agendas in different locations. These vehicles produce much more gas emissions when they travel frequently, which will affect our environment. 

Furthermore, the expansion of multinational companies also has an effect on the environment, especially our green spaces, which are decreasing. When multinational companies will expand their businesses or factories in other places, it directly affects the green ecosystem environment, which is decreasing in forest and woodland areas. The natural balance is also disturbed. For instance, Nestle company has several branch offices and factories in various countries, and this takes up a lot of land in many countries. As a result, green spaces are decreasing as this company continues to expand its businesses and factories in other countries.

In conclusion, I believe that globalization and the increasing number of multinational companies have a negative effect on the environment due to the fact that increasing gas emissions and green space issues.

title: Some people prefer to spend their lives doing the same things and avoiding changes. Others, However, think that change is always a good thing. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
content:
In the present time, individuals around the world take the view that routine is preferable to any changes. In contrast, others believe that change has a beneficial role in our lives. The objective of this essay is to discuss both of this and give my own perspective with relevant examples in the following paragraphs.

To embark with, many people avoid changes because they might like being stable without unnecessary changes. For instance, people who want to spend their lives  pursuing a single career path without any promotions. Moreover, one of the reasons why individuals tend to do this due to their fear and  not being willing to take a risk. Such risks as losing a job or hatred from colleagues. This is the most habitual for the Japanese population. Their cultural beliefs and traditions do not allow such behaviour where workers ask for a promotion. It is thought to be rude by the Japanese society. 

On the other hand, others advocate that changes are important and always have positive effects on a person and his surroundings. In other words, without change individuals can not reach their pinnacle and aim. Also, it was proven by scientists that a person who tends to change has  more changes to stay mentally health. That is because when people expand their knowledge and learn about new activities which are unusual for them, the brain  activates neurons to cope with difficulties. Therefore, these actions are connected with human change by implication. As a result, change has a positive impact on individuals' development and mental health. 

To sum up, there are two opinions, those who appreciate change and those who do not. Change has an important function in developing the brain and personality. However, some societies do not prefer change due to their culture and tradition.  From my own perspective, change matters, and being flexible is much more important nowadays than ever.

title: the diagram below shows two different processes for manufacturing black tea
content:
The diagram illustrates the processing of black tea in two ways, the Traditional method and the Modern method.

 Overall, the initial steps remain the same, that is the picking of the bud and apical leaves which ensures good quality of tea. Subsequently, almost 60% of the moisture is dehydrated by Withering the tea leaves on a rack.Next, the leaves can be processed by the novel method where the leaves are cut, torn and curled, and this results in a more efficient way of producing small granular bits in tea bags. In comparison, the conventional methodology results in loose tea leaflets, by Rolling them flat and breaking them,  which causes the release of enzymes.

After this, both kinds of by-products are subjected to Fermentation or Oxidation respectively, where the tea leaves are spread on cement or on tiles which is done in order to ensure that the enzymes react with air to produce a richer copper colour. Finally, they undergo Firing or Drying either in ovens or in air dryers ensuring 97% of the moisture content is lost, owing to the enriched aroma as well as flavour that is experienced on drinking black tea.

title:
The diagram below shows how coffee is produced and prepared for sale in supermarkets and shops.

Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features and make comparisons where relevant.
content:
The diagram illustrates several steps of how the production of coffee is carried out before being sold.

It is clear that there are 11 main stages in this process, starting with beans being picked from the trees and ending with the resulting products being packed for sale.

As can be seen, during the first step, coffee beans are collected by farmers and let dry under the sun for a few days. Next, those dried ones are roasted by heat in the oven before being cooled rapidly in a cooler. After cooling, a grinder machine is used to crush beans into powder. 

Moreover, once ground, the powder is mixed with hot water and then the mixture is strained carefully. In the following stage, it is frozen in the freezer at a low temperature before being pulverized again. Subsequently, the combination is dried in a vacuum in order to let all the left liquid evaporate. Finally, the final products are packed into jars to get ready for sale in shops and supermarkets.

title:
Some people say that parents should encourage their children to take part in

organised group activities in their free time. Others say that it is important for

children to team how to occupy themselves on their own.

Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
content:
Some family heads argue that young children should participate in social settings rather than engage in individual activities. This essay will discuss both views and why I think it is essential to mingle with others.

On the one hand, parents choose to let their children carry out free time activities on their own to develop independence. When children work independently, they acquire skills that will be useful for their future such as being able to solve problems. Furthermore, not having to spend time with a lot of people allows them to avoid disagreements with friends. Children find it easier to play online games than to go out to the park. Therefore, parents desire their children to stay home and do what they love on their own.

On the other hand, research indicates that collaboration between young children enhances social and confidence skills. First, as young youths do things with their mates, they develop good communication skills by initiating and contributing to conversations. Hence, in future when they are young adults, they are prepared to face the challenges that come with working with different people. For example, as they participate in group settings, they become capable communicators and learn from other people's perspectives. Secondly, spending time with peers' supports the development of confidence. This is achieved when youths share ideas and extend on them, as a result, they build on their self-esteem knowing that their thoughts are valued. Therefore,  it is important that children should get out of their comfort zone and meet people to strengthen life's essential skills such as social and confidence skills.

In summary, some people think children should spend time on their own, while others think they should socialise. I think the latter is essential because it helps with skills for social life and confidence.

title: Many historical sites and museums are mainly  visited by tourists, not local people. Why is this the case? What can be done to attract local people  to visit this historical  sites and museums?
content:
It is true that most historical sites and museums attract a larger number of tourists; however, local people are less interested. In my opinion, there are numerous reasons for this trend. I will discuss the reason and also give a solution in the ensuing paragraphs.

To begin with, people are bored visiting such places. In other words, local citizens know about their own cities therefore, it is not new for them. Hence, they think that such visits are a waste of time. However, tourists are very excited to explore new things in their destinations. Museums and  historical sites will help to understand the history and culture of the countries they visit. Another reason is that these types of places tickets are very expensive. If people visited once that they would not pay the higher entrance fees.

In addition, there are several solutions to these situations. Firstly, the government should organise campaigns to attract the local public such as free education seminars, health care camps and other programs which will attract. Moreover, the authority of such places gives extra discounts or is free for locals. So that, low and middle-income families can visit. For example, schools or colleges give assignments to the student related to history and they interact with historical places. Lastly, the organisation give more and more job opportunity to the local public. Hence, they work in such places and pursue more knowledge about history.

In conclusion, the government can encourage more locals by running interesting programs such as exhibits at these locations and offering free or subsidized entry.

title:
Water is a natural resource that should always be free. Governments should embargo the sale of bottled water.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?.
content:
It is argued by some individuals that government should restrict the sale of bottled water as water is a natural resource, and it should always be free of cost. However, I have a complete disagreement with this notion 

To begin with, I believe free water facilities should only be free for people in public places, remote areas, or slum areas so that people can get clean, drinkable water free of charge. For example, in Indian villages and public places, railway stations, parks, and bazaars, clear tap water is viable for residents.  But, for residential or commercial use in cities or towns, For instance, in India, city authorities charge monthly water bills for water supplies. This method has discouraged civilians from wasting water. Nevertheless, some years ago, when tap water was free, per capita water utilization was considerably higher in urban areas.

Nowadays, the sale of bottled water is increasing significantly across the world and there are some specific reasons why  it should not be banned. Firstly, before packing water in bottles, it is properly purified so that it does impact the consumers. In other words, water purification standards are met by companies becoming water bottled, while in some countries, like India, Public tap water is too polluted and can cause health issues hence people avoid even free water and prepared packed water for drinking. Secondly, the suggestion of banning packed water would not be accepted by companies and the government would face agitation, if they go for implementing it. Because this decision will adversely impact the earnings of the bottled water business. Hence it is practically impossible to stop the sales of bottled water.

All in all, I believe that government should not put restrictions on the sale of bottled water and even it is difficult to impossible to make it free for every individual.

title: Some people believe that team sports are very important for children to succeed in their career, while others disagree. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
content:
In the modern era, the majority of students are occupied with their academic lives and find little time for external sports activities, which are vital to their overall development.Some individuals believe that it is imperative that children participate in club athletics, while others disagree.In this essay, I will examine both perspectives and offer my opinion.

Initially, athletics is essential to the physical and mental development of children. To live a happy and successful life in a world where the majority of adolescents remain indoors after school or spend the majority of their time on mobile devices or viewing television, thereby negatively affecting their health, is to engage in some form of athletic activity. Group sports teach them how to collaborate in a club setting.In addition, they have the opportunity to develop leadership abilities by serving as team leaders.Lastly, how to motivate team members in low morale situations and maintain team coordination. In a recent survey conducted by the sports council of India, it was found that teenagers who perform sports concurrently with their education have greater stamina, focus, and concentration than their peers.

Opponents of group sports, on the other hand, argue that there is no need for group sports because it is a waste of time that could be spent on the academic front.Then, sometimes the leader always receives recognition for the team's overall performance, and talented youths are never given the opportunity to advance.In addition, they lose their study focus and spend the majority of their time performing sports.

In conclusion, after weighing the pros and cons, I am of the opinion that club sports are crucial to the success of children's careers and that they should participate in some form of physical activity.

title: News stories on TV and in newspapers are very often accompanied by pictures. Some people say that these pictures are more effective than words.
content:
In the modern world, photographs play a great role compared to the past. It is always a topic of discussion whether images are effective in comparison with written information or not. I will discuss this and share my opinion in the following paragraphs about these two factors.

To begin with, pictures portray a detailed explanation. For instance, a recent study of a few Indian neurologists organized a free analysis of the young generation. Under that, a few youngsters were shown certain historical images and others were given scriptures for the same pictures after a couple of hours, a few questions were asked of both groups to test them, and they found unimaginable data. Those who were shown images, were able to recall most of the data and were clear with what they saw under images, compared to 2nd group who were only able to remember a few things.    

Secondly, compared to written or visual, a shot can bring more attention and better understanding.  

Another study, which is recently published by WHO scientist Roger Federer showed that humans are more capable of remembering pictures or videos compared to written information. After hearing this data, the Indian government has decided to change the way of educating and most prominently the small kids by adding more pictures & videos along with less written information in their syllabus because it is really easy to make children understand the facts and figures.

To conclude, images and drawings are more productive than written data, furthermore, this is really important to have great memories and keep humans grateful.

title:

content:

How are you? I hope you're doing well. I writing this letter to tell you that I just heard the news about your dog had passed away. I'm sorry to hear that because I know he'd been accompany you for long time. 

We created lots of memories together, especially with your dog. In addition. I remember the first time you introduced your pet, you feel so delighted and took a lot of pictures. Moreover, your dog always love to licks someone's hand when he feels comfortable with that person, to show his kindness.

Jun

title:
Individuals should not be allowed to carry guns as it increases crime and violence in society.

To what extent do you agree or disagree
content:
In the contemporary world, although people's safety takes first priority, a school of thought holds that guns, which are actually self-defence for many residents, should be banned utterly in daily life. From my perspective, I totally concur with this tendency, as it provides multiple benefits, especially in violence and crime rates, besides some other methods to ensure people's life and health. All of them will be clarified thoroughly through this essay.

Initially, it is undeniable that guns, when being used by crime elements, ranging from thieves, robbers, gangsters, murder and so on,  become a bad thing, which put a higher risk in citizens whenever they leave their houses. Moreover, owning weapons as a defence method sometimes motivate peoples to choose violent ways when facing any issues. For instance, accommodating guns while having troubles when people's brains become impressively angry and unconscious can lead to regretful consequences, as many investigators have pointed out that people are inclined to solve problems due to their emotions more than their minds.

Besides several reasons for prohibiting  bringing guns everywhere in towns, there are many substituted methods to replace this. Firstly, there should be more investment in security guards and safety management. Gaining people's trust is often seen as a more effective and feasible way to protect human life. Secondly, raising people's awareness through some propaganda classes and educating people in the right way might help to solve this issue.

In conclusion, it will be dangerous for people and others to carry guns whenever hanging out. This tendency should be deleted utterly in everyone's opinion

title: Nowadays, people have greater access to fast food. Do advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages
content:
These days, as a result of the advent of technology in food making industry, a huge range of fast food become easily available and accessible to anyone. This, may include under-age people. Although there might be some benefits of the massive availability of fast meals, I believe that the drawbacks outweigh the benefits.

To embark on, it is true that many working parents nowadays are dependent on processed food for preparing daily meals for their families. The reason for this is that processed foods are easy to be prepared and also taste good. As a result, these parents will have more time to do other important jobs or errands. However, studies show that consuming an excessive amount of junk food has an appalling effect on our bodies. First, fast foods or processed foods have been processed through several steps before it served to the consumers. This means that essential nutrients are already cooked away and gone. This will be particularly dangerous for children as they may not receive the nutrients necessary for their growth. 

Furthermore, fast food contains a high levels of fats, calories and sugar that negatively affect our body in the long term. A study reveals that  unhealthy eating habit is one of the significant risk factors for chronic diseases such as hypertension and diabetes mellitus. These diseases are  the highest causes of death in The US and worldwide.

In conclusion, although fast food may be efficient, easy to prepare and taste good, we have to limit the consumption of this kind of food as it can have serious negative effects on our bodies.

title:
Some people fail in school, but end up being successful in life.

Why do you think that is the case?

What is the most important thing to succeed in life
content:
There is a typical case that someone who got a terrible score in school obtained remarkable achievements in their life. I think that finding a favourite job is the key to success, which directly causes this situation mentioned before. 

On the one hand, we have to recognize that customized subjects in school provide students with fewer choices, leading them to hardly dig out their actual interests. For instance, a high school always teach   teenagers some normal lessons such as math, history, science, and so on. Meanwhile, students struggle in getting good scores in the examination and thus fail to explore the thing which matches their interests and talent. Therefore, it is reasonable that some people got a lower rank in school.

On the other hand, society offers people more chance to seek their preferred job and career, which bring those who failed in their school life success. When people find things they are interested in, they tend to gain significant energy and self-satisfaction, making them take a giant step in life. Take finding a job as an example, people who are satisfied with their current job have a greater possibility of getting promoted and a big salary increment than those who lose interest in their job since they are willing to work hard in the company. Hence, people who get a favourite job and work in a suitable atmosphere tend to be successful.

Although some factors are able to create success in people's life, I consider that gaining the favourite position is the most important thing to succeed in life
